Key Match Events: Madan scored the winning goal for Bahrain in the 90+5' minute.
Al Aswad received a yellow card in the 45+1' minute.
Kutty Abba received a yellow card in the 19' minute.
Saad received a yellow card in the 52' minute.
Pre-Game Insights: For the first time in their history, Bahrain and Malaysia will square off in an Asian Cup group fixture.
Each team enters this contest with a defeat, as Bahrain were beaten 3-1 by South Korea on matchday one, while Malaysia lost 4-0 to Jordan.
Bahrain have won their last three meetings with Malaysia, conceding just once over that stretch, and have never lost in five previous Asian Cup qualifiers against them.
Malaysia returned to the group stage of the Asian Cup after over 16 years.
Malaysia suffered their worst competitive defeat since 2021 in their opening match against Jordan.
